entity.name: AcademicTerm
entity.dc:description: All Programs happen in a Period. A Period is has a start and end date. No start date of a Program may be set before the periods start Program and no end date of Program may be set after the Periods end date. One can say: A period is the program of the university, where the university consists of all departments.

attribute.name: id
attribute.dc:title: Identifikations-Nummer
numeric identifier
attribute.dc:description: An artificial key introduced to allow easy referencing of an entity. Once an id has been set it won’t change, therfore avoiding update anomalies.

attribute.name: name
attribute.dc:title: eindeutiger Name
unique name
attribute.dc:description: This is a unique name which is readable by humans and may be set by a user working with our application. A name is allowed to change, since it’s not a PRIMARY KEY. Typically it is not allowed to be NULL, since it acts as a secondary identifier.

attribute.name: start
attribute.dc:title: beginnt am
start date
attribute.dc:description: The date at which the Academic turn begins.

attribute.name: end
attribute.dc:title: endet am
end date
attribute.dc:description: The date at which the Academic turn ends.

attribute.name: start_lessons
attribute.dc:title: Kurse beginnen am
courses starting date
attribute.dc:description: The date of the first Course Element Instance taking place.

attribute.name: end_lessons
attribute.dc:title: Kurse enden am
courses ending date
attribute.dc:description: The date of the last Course Element Instance taking place.

entity.name: Attribute
entity.dc:description: The Attribute represents user-created Attributes for Persons which can be used to construct constraints.

attribute.name: id
attribute.dc:title: Identifikations-Nummer
numeric identifier
attribute.dc:description: An artificial key introduced to allow easy referencing of an entity. Once an id has been set it won’t change, therfore avoiding update anomalies.

attribute.dc:title: eindeutiger Name
unique name
attribute.dc:description: This is a unique name which is readable by humans and may be set by a user working with our application. A name is allowed to change, since it’s not a PRIMARY KEY. Typically it is not allowed to be NULL, since it acts as a secondary identifier.

entity.name: Building
entity.dc:description: A Building> has a unique street address and belongs to a Department. Some Buildings have a special name (“Henry-Ford-Building”) which is unique across the whole university.

attribute.name: id
attribute.dc:title: Identifikations-Nummer
numeric identifier
attribute.dc:description: An artificial key introduced to allow easy referencing of an entity. Once an id has been set it won’t change, therfore avoiding update anomalies.

attribute.name: name
attribute.dc:title: Name des Gebäudes
name of the building
attribute.dc:description: The name of Building has to be unique so it identifies the Building.

attribute.name: address
attribute.dc:title: Adresse
street adress
attribute.dc:description: The address of the Building has to be unique.

entity.name: Course
entity.dc:description: A Course is a well-defined set of CourseElements. For example there may be a Course which consists of two CourseElements of which one is a mandatory lecture and the other one is an optional seminar.

attribute.name: id
attribute.dc:title: Identifikations-Nummer
numeric identifier
attribute.dc:description: An artificial key introduced to allow easy referencing of an entity. Once an id has been set it won’t change, therfore avoiding update anomalies.

attribute.name: name
attribute.dc:title: eindeutiger Name
unique name
attribute.dc:description: This is a unique name which is readable by humans and may be set by a user working with our application. A name is allowed to change, since it’s not a PRIMARY KEY. Typically it is not allowed to be NULL, since it acts as a secondary identifier.

entity.name: CourseAttribute
entity.dc:description: CourseAttribute represents user-created Attributes for Courses which can be used to construct constraints.

attribute.name: id
attribute.dc:title: Identifikations-Nummer
numeric identifier
attribute.dc:description: An artificial key introduced to allow easy referencing of an entity. Once an id has been set it won’t change, therfore avoiding update anomalies.

attribute.name: name
attribute.dc:title: eindeutiger Name
unique name
attribute.dc:description: This is a unique name which is readable by humans and may be set by a user working with our application. A name is allowed to change, since it’s not a PRIMARY KEY. Typically it is not allowed to be NULL, since it acts as a secondary identifier.

attribute.name: required
attribute.dc:title: obligatorisch
obligatory
attribute.dc:description: Whether or not this Course Attribute is obligatory.

entity.name: CourseElement
entity.dc:description: A CourseElement is a type of event at a school or university, like a lecture or a seminar. A CourseElement has a duration and it may take place several times in a week (of which each occurrence has a certain duration). A CourseElement may have some dependencies regarding the Features the Room it is held in has. A CourseElement is part of a Course. It is of a certain type (e.g. lecture, seminar, discussion, meeting, ...).

attribute.name: id
attribute.dc:title: Identifikations-Nummer
numeric identifier
attribute.dc:description: An artificial key introduced to allow easy referencing of an entity. Once an id has been set it won’t change, therfore avoiding update anomalies.

attribute.name: name
attribute.dc:title: Name des Kurselements
name of the course element
attribute.dc:description: The name of the Course Element.

attribute.name: part_of
attribute.dc:title: gehört zu
part of
attribute.dc:description: The Course this Course Elements belongs to.

attribute.name: duration
attribute.dc:title: Dauer
duration
attribute.dc:description: The duration of the Course Element.

attribute.name: type
attribute.dc:title: Typ der Lehrveranstaltung
type of lessons
attribute.dc:description: The type of the Course Element.

attribute.name: required
attribute.dc:title: obligatorisch
obligatory
attribute.dc:description: Whether this Course Element is obligatory or not.

entity.name: CourseElementInstance
entity.dc:description: A CourseElementInstance is created within a Program belonging to a CourseInstance. It is a CourseElement actually taking place.

attribute.name: id
attribute.dc:title: Identifikations-Nummer
numeric identifier
attribute.dc:description: An artificial key introduced to allow easy referencing of an entity. Once an id has been set it won’t change, therfore avoiding update anomalies.

attribute.dc:title: ist Teil von
is a part of
attribute.dc:description: The Course this Course Element Instance is part of.

attribute.name: course_element
attribute.dc:title: abgeleitet von
derived from
attribute.dc:description: The Course Element this Course Element Instance is derived from.

attribute.name: starting_timeslot
attribute.dc:title: Beginn
begin
attribute.dc:description: The starting Timeslot this Course Element Instance is beginning at.

attribute.name: lecturer
attribute.dc:title: Dozent
docent
attribute.dc:description: The teacher for this Course Element Instance.

attribute.name: duration
attribute.dc:title: Dauer
duration
attribute.dc:description: The duration of this Course Element Instance.

attribute.name: schedulable_lesson
attribute.dc:title: Schedulebar
scheduleable
attribute.dc:description: Whether or not this Course Element Instance is scheduleable.

entity.name: CourseElementType
entity.dc:description: A CourseElementType describes a type of event, like a lecture or a seminar.

entity.name: CourseInstance
entity.dc:description: A CourseInstance is created within a Program. It is a Course actually taking place. There can be several CourseInstances of the same Course within a program. There is a main lecturer being primary responsible for any CourseInstance.

attribute.name: id
attribute.dc:title: Identifikations-Nummer
numeric identifier
attribute.dc:description: An artificial key introduced to allow easy referencing of an entity. Once an id has been set it won’t change, therfore avoiding update anomalies.

attribute.name: program
attribute.dc:title: läuft innerhalb von
takes place in
attribute.dc:description: The Program this Course Instance is running in.

attribute.name: start
attribute.dc:title: beginnt am
start date
attribute.dc:description: The start date of the Course Instance.

attribute.name: end
attribute.dc:title: endet am
end date
attribute.dc:description: The end date of the Course Instance.

attribute.name: main_lecturer
attribute.dc:title: Dozent
teacher
attribute.dc:description: The docent for this Course Element.

entity.name: Day
entity.dc:description: A Day holds a set of Timeslots.

entity.name: Department
entity.dc:description: A logical group of several entities. Persons, Buildings and Courses belong to a Department. Buildings may belong to several Departments.

attribute.name: id
attribute.dc:title: Identifikations-Nummer
numeric identifier
attribute.dc:description: An artificial key introduced to allow easy referencing of an entity. Once an id has been set it won’t change, therfore avoiding update anomalies.

attribute.name: name
attribute.dc:title: eindeutiger Name
unique name
attribute.dc:description: This is a unique name which is readable by humans and may be set by a user working with our application. A name is allowed to change, since it’s not a PRIMARY KEY. Typically it is not allowed to be NULL, since it acts as a secondary identifier.

attribute.name: superordinate_department
attribute.dc:title: Übergeordneter Fachbereich
superordinated department
attribute.dc:description: The superordinated department of this department.

entity.name: Feature
entity.dc:description: Rooms do have certain Features which may have a certain quantity. A Feature is identified by a name (“seats”, “beamers”, ...). For example any Room which is suitable to hold a lecture or a seminar in it will have a certain amount of seats, a lab has a certain amount of workplaces. While an auditorium may have 300 seats suitable for doing a lecture it might have only 75 seats suitable for doing an examination.

attribute.name: id
attribute.dc:title: Identifikations-Nummer
numeric identifier
attribute.dc:description: An artificial key introduced to allow easy referencing of an entity. Once an id has been set it won’t change, therfore avoiding update anomalies.

attribute.dc:title: eindeutiger Name
unique name
attribute.dc:description: This is a unique name which is readable by humans and may be set by a user working with our application. A name is allowed to change, since it’s not a PRIMARY KEY. Typically it is not allowed to be NULL, since it acts as a secondary identifier.

entity.name: Person
entity.dc:description: A Person is a natural person who is able to login to myCourses. Therefore she is having login credentials (e.g. username and password or mail address and password). Every Person has a first name and a last name. There are many different roles at a university and there are persons who act in more than one role (e.g. there are students doing lectures, while not being professors). Every person needs to have a unique identifier regardless of the roles they belong to for administration reasons.

attribute.name: id
attribute.dc:title: Identifikations-Nummer
numeric identifier
attribute.dc:description: An artificial key introduced to allow easy referencing of an entity. Once an id has been set it won’t change, therfore avoiding update anomalies.

attribute.name: first_name
attribute.dc:title: Vorname
first name
attribute.dc:description: The first name of a Person.

attribute.name: additional_names
attribute.dc:title: weitere Namen
additional names
attribute.dc:description: Additional names of a Person.

attribute.name: last_name
attribute.dc:title: Nachname
last name
attribute.dc:description: The last name of a Person.

attribute.name: email_address
attribute.dc:title: eMail-Adresse
email address
attribute.dc:description: The email address of a Person. It has to be unique.

attribute.name: login_name
attribute.dc:title: Login-Name
login name
attribute.dc:description: The name that is used to log into the system. It has to be unique.

attribute.name: login_password
attribute.dc:title: Passwort
password
attribute.dc:description: The password that is used together with the login name in order to log in into the system.

attribute.name: home_department
attribute.dc:title: Heimatinstitut
Home department
attribute.dc:description: The department a student is registered at.

attribute.name: login_count
attribute.dc:title: Counts how many times the user logged in to the system.
Zähler über die Anzahl der logins.

attribute.name: is_superuser
attribute.dc:title: ist Administrator
is administrator
attribute.dc:description: Attribute that shows whether the Person is a superuser or not.

attribute.name: deleted
attribute.dc:title: gelöscht
deleted
attribute.dc:description: Attribute that shows on which date a Person was deleted from the system.

attribute.name: deleted_by
attribute.dc:title: gelöscht von
deleted by
attribute.dc:description: Attribute that shows by which Person the User was deleted.

attribute.name: is_student
attribute.dc:title: Matrikelnummer
student number
attribute.dc:description: The number identifies the Person (student) uniquely.

attribute.name: is_lecturer
attribute.dc:title: gelöscht von
deleted by
attribute.dc:description: If part of the staff the staff ID will identify the Persion uniquely.

entity.name: Privilege
entity.dc:description: A privilege represents the permission to do specific tasks, such as logging in, changing data of courses or publishing the shedule.

attribute.name: id
attribute.dc:title: Identifikations-Nummer
numeric identifier
attribute.dc:description: An artificial key introduced to allow easy referencing of an entity. Once an id has been set it won’t change, therfore avoiding update anomalies.

attribute.name: name
attribute.dc:title: eindeutiger Name
unique name
attribute.dc:description: This is a unique name which is readable by humans and may be set by a user working with our application. A name is allowed to change, since it’s not a PRIMARY KEY. Typically it is not allowed to be NULL, since it acts as a secondary identifier.

entity.name: Program
entity.dc:description: A Program is a set of CourseInstances. It has a running period (start and end date). A program manager is responsible for a Program. A Program belongs to a Department and to one Department only.

attribute.name: id
attribute.dc:title: Identifikations-Nummer
numeric identifier
attribute.dc:description: An artificial key introduced to allow easy referencing of an entity. Once an id has been set it won’t change, therfore avoiding update anomalies.

attribute.name: academic_term
attribute.dc:title: gehört zu Semester
belongs to academic term
attribute.dc:description: The academic turn this Program is running it.

attribute.name: department
attribute.dc:title: gehört zum Fachbereich
belongs to department
attribute.dc:description: The department to which this Program is belonging.

attribute.name: freezed
attribute.dc:title: Eingefroren(fertig geplant)
freezed(got ready)
attribute.dc:description: Whether or not the Program is freezed i.e. no Courses Element Instances will change their place in the Shedule any more.

attribute.name: published
attribute.dc:title: Veröffentlicht
published
attribute.dc:description: Whether or not the Program is already released or not.

attribute.name: program_manager
attribute.dc:title: Programm Manager
program manager
attribute.dc:description: The program manager for this Program i.e. the person which is responsible for it.

attribute.name: id
attribute.dc:title: Identifikations-Nummer
numeric identifier
attribute.dc:description: An artificial key introduced to allow easy referencing of an entity. Once an id has been set it won’t change, therfore avoiding update anomalies.

entity.name: Role
entity.dc:description: A role bundles a set of privileges i.e. permissions a user gains when having one or more roles. The right managment is not hierarchal, it is plain.

attribute.name: id
attribute.dc:title: Identifikations-Nummer
numeric identifier
attribute.dc:description: An artificial key introduced to allow easy referencing of an entity. Once an id has been set it won’t change, therfore avoiding update anomalies.

attribute.name: name
attribute.dc:title: eindeutiger Name
unique name
attribute.dc:description: This is a unique name which is readable by humans and may be set by a user working with our application. A name is allowed to change, since it’s not a PRIMARY KEY. Typically it is not allowed to be NULL, since it acts as a secondary identifier.

entity.name: Room
entity.dc:description: A Room is a physical location where CourseElementInstances take place. A Room has an identifier which uniquely identifies it across the whole university. A Room is located inside a Building. Every Room has a number which is unique in the Building. A Room has Features and it may have a certain quantity of any Feature (e.g. 300 seats, a beamer, 20 workstations). Some Rooms do have a special name (“Audimax”) which is unique in the building. A Room may be of a certain type (auditorium, lab, ...). Not all rooms are always available.

attribute.name: id
attribute.dc:title: Identifikations-Nummer
numeric identifier
attribute.dc:description: An artificial key introduced to allow easy referencing of an entity. Once an id has been set it won’t change, therfore avoiding update anomalies.

attribute.name: name
attribute.dc:title: Name des Raumes
name of the room
attribute.dc:description: The Roomname is unique per Building and identifies the Room in this Building.

attribute.name: number
attribute.dc:title: Raum-Nummer
room number
attribute.dc:description: The Roomnumber has not to be unique. It is an alternative name for the Room.

attribute.name: building
attribute.dc:title: ist in Gebäude
located in
attribute.dc:description: The Buildingname is unique and represents a location where the Room is.

entity.name: Timeslot
entity.dc:description: A Timeslot represents a duration in time in which a CourseElementInstance can take place.

attribute.name: id
attribute.dc:title: Identifikations-Nummer
numeric identifier
attribute.dc:description: An artificial key introduced to allow easy referencing of an entity. Once an id has been set it won’t change, therfore avoiding update anomalies.

attribute.name: day
attribute.dc:title: Tag an welchem der Entsprechende Timeslot liegt.
Day on which this Timeslot takes place.
attribute.dc:description: The Day on which the Timeslot will be placed.

attribute.name: startingTime
attribute.dc:title: Uhrzeit zu der der Kurs anfaengt.
Time on which the CourseElementInstance will begin.
attribute.dc:description: Time on which the COurseElementInstance will begin.

entity.name: Year
entity.dc:title: Jahrgang
year
entity.dc:description: Typically Students start studying sometime and end studying sometime later and their course of studies has a regular length. Of course Courses a Student has to enroll in in the same year must not overlap. That is what Year is for. Courses may be assigned to a certain Year (e.g. first year, second year), but they do not necessarily have to.

attribute.name: id
attribute.dc:title: Identifikations-Nummer
numeric identifier
attribute.dc:description: An artificial key introduced to allow easy referencing of an entity. Once an id has been set it won’t change, therfore avoiding update anomalies.

attribute.name: name
attribute.dc:title: eindeutiger Name
unique name
attribute.dc:description: This is a unique name which is readable by humans and may be set by a user working with our application. A name is allowed to change, since it’s not a PRIMARY KEY. Typically it is not allowed to be NULL, since it acts as a secondary identifier.

relationship.name: courseHasCourseAttribute
relationship.subject: Course
relationship.dc:description: This relation tells us that the given Course has the given Attribute.

relationship.name: courseRecommendedForYear
relationship.subject: Course
relationship.dc:description: This relation gives the Person(students) a hint in which Course they should enroll in order to maintain their studies in order.

relationship.name: courseRequiresCourse
relationship.subject: Course
relationship.dc:description: This relation tells us that it is neccessary to take part in the first Course in order to take part in the second Course.

relationship.name: elementInstancePrefersRoom
relationship.subject: CourseElementInstance
relationship.dc:description: This relation describes that the given CourseElementInstance is better to be placed in the given Room.

relationship.name: elementInstancePrefersTimeslot
relationship.subject: CourseElementInstance
relationship.dc:description: This relation describes that the given CourseElementInstance is better to be placed in the given Timeslot.

relationship.name: elementInstanceRequiresFeature
relationship.subject: CourseElementInstance
relationship.dc:description: This relation tells us what kind of Feature is needed or whished by the Person which holds this particular CourseElementInstance.

attribute.name: quantity_min
attribute.dc:title: Mindestanzahl des Features die vorhanden sein muss
minimum number of the feature required

attribute.name: quantity_better
attribute.dc:title: Anzahl des Features welche besser wäre
number of features that would be better

relationship.name: elementInstanceTakesPlaceInRoom
relationship.subject: CourseElementInstance
relationship.dc:description: This relation tells us that the mentioned CourseElementInstance is taking place in the given Room.

attribute.name: timeslot
attribute.dc:title: Zeitfenster
timeslot
attribute.dc:description: The Timeslot in which the Course Element Instance will take place in the given Room.

relationship.name: elementRequiresFeature
relationship.subject: CourseElement
relationship.dc:description: This relation tells us what kind and amount of Feature is required in order to be held.

attribute.name: quantity_min
attribute.dc:title: Mindestanzahl des Features die vorhanden sein muss
minimum number of the feature required

attribute.name: quantity_better
attribute.dc:title: Anzahl des Features welche besser wäre
number of features that would be better

relationship.name: personEnrolledInCourseInstance
relationship.subject: Person
relationship.dc:description: This relation gives us the Persons that are enrolled to a specific CourseInstance.

relationship.name: personGivesCourse
relationship.subject: Person
relationship.dc:description: This relation tells us which Persons are holding which Courses.

relationship.name: personHasAttribute
relationship.subject: Person
relationship.dc:description: This relation tells us that the Person mentioned has the Attribute given.

relationship.name: personHasPrivilege
relationship.subject: Person
relationship.dc:description: This relation tells us that the given Person has the given Privilege.

attribute.name: target
attribute.dc:title: Ziel
target
attribute.dc:description: The target of this relation (should be a Person) will gain the new Privilege.

attribute.name: because_of_role
attribute.dc:title: aufgrund der Rolle
because of role
attribute.dc:description: This is a explanation because of which Role the Privilege was gained.

relationship.name: personHasRole
relationship.subject: Person
relationship.dc:description: This relation tells us that the given Person has the given Role.

relationship.name: personPrefersTimeslot
relationship.subject: Person
relationship.dc:description: This relation describes that the given person wants this Timeslot more than other timeslots.

relationship.name: personSuccessfullyPassedCourse
relationship.subject: Person
relationship.dc:description: This relation tells us that a Person has passed a specific Course.

attribute.name: grade
attribute.dc:title: Note
grade
attribute.dc:description: The grade the Person got in the specified Course.

attribute.name: notes
attribute.dc:title: Anmerkungen
notes
attribute.dc:description: Notes regarding the Person in question.

relationship.name: personTakesPartInElementInstance
relationship.subject: Person
relationship.dc:description: This relation tells us that the given Person takes part in the mentioned CourseElementInstance.

attribute.name: timeslot
attribute.dc:title: Zeitfenster
timeslot
attribute.dc:description: The Timeslot in which the Person will take part in the given Course Element Instance

relationship.name: roleImpliesAttribute
relationship.subject: Role
relationship.dc:description: This relation keeps track of user-defined Attributes that are implied by a role.

attribute.name: default
attribute.dc:title: Standardmäßig
default
attribute.dc:description: Describes whether or not this attribute is set by default.

attribute.name: required
attribute.dc:title: benötigt
required
attribute.dc:description: Whether or not this Attribute is required or not.

relationship.name: roleImpliesPrivilege
relationship.subject: Role
relationship.dc:description: This relation tells us what Privileges are implied by a given Role.

attribute.name: target
attribute.dc:title: Ziel
target
attribute.dc:description: The target of this relation (should be a Role) will gain the new Privilege.

relationship.name: roomPrefersTimeslot
relationship.subject: Room
relationship.dc:description: This relation describes that the given Room should be booked at the given Timeslot.

relationship.name: roomProvidesFeature
relationship.subject: Room
relationship.dc:description: This relation tells us which Feature is provided by this room.

attribute.name: quantity
attribute.dc:title: Quantität
quantity
attribute.dc:description: The quantity in which the Room provides the Feature of question.
